update.description:
‌

* filled out the SensorCompliance. It is formatted by the sensors\_compliance files
* styling
* added roslaunch params

thruster bounding boxes visualized

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3286679424-thrusters.png)
  
sensor bounding boxes visualized

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/482578878-comp_show.png)
number test and permitted parameters are configured by sensor\_compliance/numeric.yaml and thruster\_compliance/numeric.yaml

bounding boxes are configured by

sensor\_compliance/visual.sdf and thruster\_compliance/visual.sdf

example yamls:

sensor\_num\_fail will fail because too many cameras

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: middle_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

sensor\_bounding fail will fail because one of the cameras is not in bounds:

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 2
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

sensors config will work:

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

thruster\_config will not fail:

```
engine:
    - prefix: "left"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "right"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "middle"
      position: "-2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
```

thruster\_config\_num\_fail will fail due too too any engines

```
engine:
    - prefix: "aft_port"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "aft_star"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "aft_center"
      position: "-2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "for_port"
      position: "1 .8 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "for_star"
      position: "1 -.8 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
```

thruster\_config\_bounding\_fail will fail due too bounding box:

```
engine:
    - prefix: "left"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "right"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "middle"
      position: "2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"wamv
```

content.raw:
Not sure if this is in the scope of this PR, but the default locations for _imu_ and _gps_ are out of bounds. Might be nice to move them to a valid position.

```
[ERROR] [1560807825.480374]: wamv_imu imu_wamv is out of bounds
[ERROR] [1560807825.481932]: wamv_imu imu_wamv is at xyz=(0.0, 0.0, 1.3), must fit in at least one of the following boxes:
[ERROR] [1560807825.483328]:   <Box x:[1.3, 0.3] y:[0.5,-0.5] z:[2.3,1.3]>
[ERROR] [1560807825.484722]:   <Box x:[-0.65, -1.15] y:[0.5,-0.5] z:[2.3,1.3]>
```

content.raw: Wow this is really nice! I like how clearly you made these error messages so people will surely know that the generated urdf is not compliant, but still creates a urdf that is usable. I really like how you display the boxes and the current position, as it makes is so much easier to fix an invalid config yaml. Great work!

update.title: Issue#99 wamv compliance

content.raw:
Hi Tyler,

Thanks for checking out my PR, I really appreciate your input!

I have changed the behavior of create\_xacro\_file to return False if a compliance test is failed and  only assert => fail when a macro is attempted that is not defined under the specified directory. \(this is because we presumably MUST have the default parameter values\) All fail conditions \(including the aforementioned assert=>fail\) now have a rospy logerr message. All compliance test failures will now be shown and the non compliance wamv will be generated. Also, during the error the box bounds are printed to help with debug.

ie: when running with thruster\_config\_bounds\_fail.yaml and sensor\_num\_fail.yaml

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/36110368-compliance_error.png)
content.html:

All compliance test failures will now be shown and the non compliance wamv will be generated. Also, during the error the box bounds are printed to help with debug.

ie: when running with thruster_config_bounds_fail.yaml and sensor_num_fail.yaml

update.title: Issue#99 wamv compliance

content.raw:
I was just testing this out with a few yaml files and **I think it works really well.** The simple check of being in the correct bounding box and within the number limit is a good way to check for compliance.

I have some suggestions I thought might be valuable. I was trying out the sensor compliance with the the sensor yaml file shown below. I have multiple “incompliances” including: 

* Too many cameras
* GPS invalid params
* IMU invalid params

**The issue I found was that it was not super easy for me to go from an invalid one to a valid one.** When I had this gps out of bounds error, I didn’t know in which dimension. A few suggestions I’d have \(let me know your thoughts on these, just my opinion\):

* Maybe don’t assert => fail to run, but still create the urdf so it can be seen visually, especially if teams just want to play around with different configurations, it might be nice for them to still be allowed to create urdfs with invalid configurations, just as long as they know for sure it’s invalid for competition
* I would like it if the key reasons for failure were colored yellow or red such as `wamv_gps gps_wamv is out of bounds`, only if its easy/doable
* I would like it if more than one reason for failure could be shown. For example here, I have 3 compliance issues, but the script ends and only tells me one, so I had to run this script about 5 times figuring out which direction to move the gps, then run it again to find about imu and solve that, then run it again to find about camera. Showing all errors at once would be cool
* If possible \(might be infeasible\), maybe say which xyz is out of bounds/which direction \(probably which direction impossible based on the 2 bounding boxes\) 
* Double check that the “default xyz” are all in valid positions \(for imu, when I put no params for xyz \(default\), it was invalid and I had no idea what range of x, y, z to even try because I can’t visualize the invalid configuration and default is not shown\)

Keep up the great work!

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3143616145-Testing_Compliance.png)
content.html:

  • Maybe don’t assert => fail to run, but still create the urdf so it can be seen visually, especially if teams just want to play around with different configurations, it might be nice for them to still be allowed to create urdfs with invalid configurations, just as long as they know for sure it’s invalid for competition

For example here, I have 3 compliance issues, but the script ends and only tells me one, so I had to run this script about 5 times figuring out which direction to move the gps, then run it again to find about imu and solve that, then run it again to find about camera. Showing all errors at once would be cool

This part looks really clear :slight_smile: Nitpick, It would probably be good to have Carlos’s opinion on this, but maybe we could use one of

```
rospy.logdebug(msg, *args)
rospy.logwarn(msg, *args)
rospy.loginfo(msg, *args)
rospy.logerr(msg, *args)
rospy.logfatal(msg, *args)
```

instead of print/assert? Just an idea, so errors/mistakes can be more easily noticed.
